Macron vows to serve 'until the last second' of presidency
Subhead: Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday he would see out his second term despite record-low approval ratings and deep political deadlock, pledging to govern through his final full year in office ahead of the 2027 election.

Title: World rings in 2026 after a year of truces and turmoil
Trump says he is dropping push for National Guard in Chicago, LA and Portland, for now
Donald Trump's attacks reopen South Africa's wounds
Subhead: Echoing the ideas of Afrikaner nationalist movements, the White House lends credibility to the claim of an alleged 'genocide' against South Africa's white minority, in what remains the world's most unequal country, where this minority still holds the majority of wealth.

Title: Social movement led by shopkeepers shakes the Iranian regime
Subhead: The collapse of the rial deepens the economic struggles faced by retailers, who have taken to the streets in several major cities. Some universities in Tehran have also joined the mobilization. Economic grievances have merged with increasingly political slogans.

Title: France seeks to ban social media for children under 15
Subhead: The initiative is backed by President Emmanuel Macron, who said earlier this month that Parliament should start debating such a proposal in January.

Title: Trump takes the lead as the US celebrates 250 years of independence
Subhead: Ahead of the anniversary of the 1776 Declaration of Independence, Americans are urged to celebrate the nation's history and ideals of exceptionalism, as Donald Trump moves to gain control over anniversary events alongside a nonpartisan commission created in 2016.

New Year's Eve 2015 in Cologne: The night that traumatized thousands of women and shook Germany
Subhead: On New Year's Eve in 2015, more than 1,000 women were sexually assaulted in Cologne by groups of men, many from North Africa and the Middle East, triggering a fierce debate over Germany's refugee policy. Ten years on, victims say their trauma was politicized, as they continue to live with the consequences of that night.

Title: Sex: Should you really 'enjoy yourself before settling down' and entering a relationship?
Subhead: Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette challenges arguments that urge young people to expand their range of sexual experiences and partners – especially maxims that undermine the value of relationships.

Title: 'In the beginning, I was very diligent, more than other believers from Muslim backgrounds': Grégory's conversion to Islam
Subhead: 'Changing Faith' (3/11). Why do people choose a particular religion? Attracted from a young age to Islam, Grégory Gonty, a 35-year-old Belgian social worker, became Muslim at the age of 21. The fervent believer has since become a knowledgeable and inquisitive practitioner.
